title: Dodges, Dodges Everywhere.
body: Lemme first state that the new champ selection system is pretty well thought out (Mostly) and is absolutely beautiful. That being said my queue times have basically gone from 3-7 min to 30min+ due to dodges. I understand that asking players to pick two roles will effectively lower queues times. But really adding all the dodges this has been the complete opposite for me. And the fact that there is only ranked draft and regular draft right now makes for an extremely unbalanced  team. Im silver 3 and was getting level 24 in my matches...

replies.body: A lot of people are dodging becasue they havn't gotten used to the new match system. Like how you HAVE to press lock in/ ban to select a champion, and if you don't do that, then you will be kicked out of the match for being 'afk'. Give people 2 days to get used to the system before you complain about it.
I like it because I don't have to wait 90 seconds for someone to lock in.
The exact same thing happened on PBE. Times shot through the roof for the first 2-3 days, then dropped back as they learned.
prob cause the gray wall bug
People will get used to locking in, eventually. Same thing happened on PBE.
It's really annoying, or the people that will get the secondary role but say "____ or feed"

i dodged a game cause i got top instead of adc
Dodges? Why? You're CHOOSING the roles that you want, why would anybody dodge?

> [{quoted}](name=Maratsune,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=R27Iq1Hh,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-01-15T18:11:02.444+0000)
>
> Dodges? Why? You're CHOOSING the roles that you want, why would anybody dodge?

It has to do with people alt tabbing out and not realizing that it's their turn. The new CS doesn't pull you back to the client automatically when it's your turn to pick like before, and just selecting the champion before your time is up isn't enough, you have to select and lock in.

Guarantees that there will be a drop in DCs at the start of games, but people are missing their lock in Windows.
24's against 30's was a flaw in the old system too.
or just remove dynamic queue in general...or split it...so premades dont go vs randoms...
They should probably change the "Done" button to a "Locked In" or "Ready" button.
